main_page.title: Before and after you leave Australia
main_page.summary: The page provides guidance for people leaving Australia, covering tax implications of selling property, steps to take before departure, and how to access superannuation after leaving. It also outlines eligibility rules and procedures for claiming the Departing Australia Superannuation Payment (DASP).

selling_property_tax_rules.foreign_residents_cgt_exemption: Foreign residents cannot claim the CGT main residence exemption when selling Australian residential property, except in limited circumstances.
selling_property_tax_rules.pre_9_may_2017_rule: Before 9 May 2017, foreign residents who had been Australian residents could claim the CGT main residence exemption.

before_you_leave.border_guidance: See what to do when you cross the border.

assistance_programs.return_and_reintegration_assistance: Available for people needing help to leave Australia.
assistance_programs.status_resolution_service: Available for people with complex visa issues or difficult personal circumstances.

conflict_zone_warning.legal_note: It is an offence to intentionally enter or remain in a declared zone.

super_eligibility_work_conditions.earnings_requirement: Paid AUD 450 or more before tax in a month

dasp_eligibility.not_citizen_or_pr: Must not be an Australian or New Zealand citizen or permanent resident
dasp_eligibility.temporary_visa: Must have entered on a temporary visa (except Subclass 405 or 410)
dasp_eligibility.no_active_visa: Must no longer have any Australian visas in effect (including tourist visas)

dasp_steps.step_1: Check temporary visa status via VEVO.
dasp_steps.step_2: Request cancellation of temporary visa (if applicable).

step_3.free_online_method: Apply via ATO DASP online system once visa has expired.

paper_method.when_to_use: Only when ATO online cannot be used
paper_method.required: Submit correct ATO paper form (fees may apply)

child_pages.title: Before and after you leave Australia
child_pages.summary: This page provides information for people leaving Australia, including tax implications of selling property, assistance programs, avoiding conflict zones, and accessing superannuation after departure. It explains eligibility for the Departing Australia Superannuation Payment (DASP) and the steps required to claim it.

cgt_main_residence_exemption.previous_rule: Foreign residents who had been Australian residents could claim the CGT main residence exemption before 9 May 2017.

before_leaving.border_crossing_info: See what to do when you cross the border.

assistance_programs.status_resolution_service: Available for people with complex visa situations or difficult circumstances

conflict_zones.legal_note: Offence to intentionally enter or remain in a declared zone.

conditions: Paid AUD450 or more in a month (before tax)

dasp_eligibility.citizenship_requirements: Not an Australian or New Zealand citizen or permanent resident
dasp_eligibility.visa_requirements: Entered Australia on a temporary visa (except Subclass 405 or 410)
dasp_eligibility.visa_status: Must no longer have any Australian visas in effect

paper_form.when_required: Only if online service cannot be used

child_pages.title: Before and after you leave Australia
child_pages.summary: This page provides guidance for individuals leaving Australia, including tax implications when selling property, steps to take before departure, and how to access superannuation after leaving the country. It outlines programs for assistance, warnings about conflict zones, and detailed steps to claim Departing Australia Superannuation Payment (DASP).

cgt_main_residence_exemption.pre_2017_rule: Foreign residents who had been Australian residents could claim the CGT main residence exemption when selling Australian residential property.

before_leaving_australia.border_requirements: See what to do when you cross the border.

assistance_programs.return_and_reintegration_assistance_prog: Available for people needing help to leave Australia.
assistance_programs.status_resolution_service: Available for people with complex visa situations or difficult personal circumstances.

conflict_zone_warning.legal_note: It is an offence to intentionally enter or remain in a declared zone.
conflict_zone_warning.reference: Declared zones listed at Australian National Security.

dasp_eligibility.citizenship_residency_requirement: Not an Australian or New Zealand citizen, and not a permanent resident

steps.method: Use VEVO (Visa Entitlement Verification Online system)

paper_form.description: Used only when online service is unavailable
paper_form.payment_instruction: Pre-pay AUD55 via ImmiAccount (specific payment path provided)

child_pages.title: Before and after you leave Australia
child_pages.summary: The page provides guidance for people leaving Australia, including tax implications when selling property, steps to follow before departure, and how to access superannuation after leaving. It outlines eligibility requirements for the Departing Australia Superannuation Payment (DASP) and details the process for claiming it. It also highlights assistance programs and warnings about travelling to conflict zones.

selling_property_tax_rules.foreign_residents_cgt_main_residence_exe: Foreign residents cannot claim the CGT main residence exemption when selling Australian residential property except in limited circumstances.
selling_property_tax_rules.historical_rule_change_date: Before 9 May 2017, former Australian residents could still claim the exemption.

before_you_leave.border_guidance: See what to do when you cross the border.

assistance_programs.return_and_reintegration_assistance_prog: Provides support to people needing help to leave Australia.
assistance_programs.status_resolution_service: Provides help to people with complex visa situations or difficult personal circumstances.

conflict_zone_warning.legal_note: It is an offence to intentionally enter or remain in a declared zone.
conflict_zone_warning.reference: Declared zones listed on Australian National Security.

conditions_to_have_super: Paid AUD450 or more before tax in a month
eligibility_for_dasp: Not an Australian or New Zealand citizen or Australian permanent resident
Entered Australia on a temporary visa (excluding Subclass 405 or 410)
No Australian visas currently in effect, including tourist visas

steps.title: Cancel temporary visa
steps.details: May request cancellation of your temporary visa.

options.online_ato: Use ATO’s DASP online system for free after visa expiry.

paper_form.description: Only if ATO online service cannot be used.
requirements: Submit the correct ATO paper form (fees may apply)
Pre-pay AUD55 in ImmiAccount for paper application processing

child_pages.title: Before and after you leave Australia
child_pages.summary: The page provides guidance for people leaving Australia, including tax implications of selling property, steps to take before departure, and how to access superannuation after leaving. It outlines assistance programs, travel warnings, and the process for claiming a Departing Australia Superannuation Payment (DASP). Key eligibility rules and procedural steps are included.

cgt_main_residence_exemption.foreign_residents_eligibility: Foreign residents cannot claim the CGT main residence exemption when selling Australian residential property (except limited circumstances).
cgt_main_residence_exemption.historical_rule: Before 9 May 2017, foreign residents who had been Australian residents could claim the exemption.

before_you_leave.border_guidance: See what to do when you cross the border.

assistance_programs.return_and_reintegration_assistance_prog: Available for people needing help to leave Australia.
assistance_programs.status_resolution_service: Supports people with complex visa situations or difficult personal circumstances.

conflict_zone_warning.legal_note: It is an offence to intentionally enter or remain in a declared zone.
conflict_zone_warning.reference: Declared zones listed at Australian National Security.

super_accrual_conditions: Paid AUD450 or more before tax in a month
dasp_eligibility: Not an Australian or New Zealand citizen, and not a permanent resident
Entered on a temporary visa (excluding Subclass 405 and 410)
No Australian visas active, including tourist visas

steps.title: Cancel temporary visa
steps.details: In some cases you may request cancellation.

methods.online_free: Use the ATO’s DASP online system.

paper_form.description: Send the correct ATO paper form to your super fund or ATO.

immiaccount_payment.instructions: Pay through ImmiAccount under My Payments > Manage Payments > Pre-Pay Paper > Pay other applications.

child_pages.title: Before and after you leave Australia
child_pages.summary: The page provides guidance for people leaving Australia, including tax implications when selling property, what to do before departure, and how to access superannuation after leaving. It explains eligibility for the Departing Australia Superannuation Payment (DASP) and outlines the steps required to claim it. Additional information is provided on assistance programs and avoiding travel to conflict zones.

selling_property_tax_rules.foreign_residents_cgt_main_residence_exe: Foreign residents cannot claim the CGT main residence exemption when selling Australian residential property, except in limited circumstances.
selling_property_tax_rules.previous_rule: Before 9 May 2017, foreign residents who had been Australian residents could claim the CGT main residence exemption on residential property sales.

before_you_leave.border_crossing_info: See what to do when you cross the border.

assistance_programs.return_and_reintegration_assistance_prog: Provides help to eligible people needing assistance to leave Australia.
assistance_programs.status_resolution_service: Supports people with complex visa situations or difficult personal circumstances.

conflict_zones_warning.legal_note: It is an offence to intentionally enter or remain in a declared zone.

likely_super_conditions: Paid AUD450 or more before tax in a month
dasp_eligibility: Not an Australian or New Zealand citizen, or a permanent resident
Entered Australia on a temporary visa (except Subclass 405 or 410)
No Australian visas currently in effect, including tourist visas

steps.description: Check temporary visa status through VEVO.
Request cancellation of temporary visa (if eligible).

application_methods.online_free: Apply through ATO’s DASP online system (verifies departure and visa expiry).

paper_form_option.description: Send correct ATO paper form to super fund or ATO.
paper_form_option.additional_fee: AUD55 pre-payment via ImmiAccount when unable to use ATO Online Service.

structured_data.page_title: Before and after you leave Australia

cgt_main_residence_exemption.previous_rule: Before 9 May 2017, foreign residents who had been Australian residents could claim the CGT main residence exemption when selling Australian residential property.

before_you_leave.border_guidance: See what to do when you cross the border.

assistance_programs.return_and_reintegration_assistance_prog: Provides help to people needing assistance to leave Australia.
assistance_programs.status_resolution_service: Supports people with complex visa situations or difficult personal circumstances.

conflict_zone_warning.legal_note: It is an offence to intentionally enter or remain in a declared zone.
conflict_zone_warning.reference: Declared zones listed by Australian National Security.

eligibility.citizenship_status: Not an Australian or New Zealand citizen and not a permanent resident

steps.title: Check temporary visa status
steps.details: Verify visa expiry using VEVO (Visa Entitlement Verification Online).

steps.title: Cancel temporary visa
steps.details: Request cancellation of your temporary visa when eligible.

steps.title: Apply for DASP
steps.details: Submit your claim once your temporary visa has expired or been cancelled.

paper_form.description: Only required if the online service cannot be used.
paper_form.requirements: Submit the correct ATO paper form to your super fund or the ATO.

prepayment.instructions: Make payment under My Payments > Manage Payments > Pre-Pay Paper > Pay other applications.
